meanings.definition: A person who seems or appears to be a certain way.
meanings.sent1: The new student in class is one of those seemers who always looks confident.
meanings.sent2: She is a seemers, always smiling even when she is sad.
meanings.sent3: The seemers at the party pretended to be famous celebrities for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the crowd, the seemers stood out like bright stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The little girl loved to play dress-up and pretend to be different seemers every day.

meanings.definition: To give the impression of being a certain way.
meanings.sent1: His excuses seemers to be valid, but I am not sure if they are true.
meanings.sent2: The magician can seemers to make objects disappear with his tricks.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemers to think it is a dog, chasing its tail around the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemers to brighten up the room whenever she enters.
meanings.sent5: The painting seemers to come to life, capturing the beauty of nature in vivid colors.

meanings.definition: The act of appearing or giving the impression of being a certain way.
meanings.sent1: The seemers of happiness on her face were contagious, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent2: His seemers of confidence helped him ace the job interview.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's seemers of sadness on stage were actually part of his act.
meanings.sent4: The seemers of success surrounded her, motivating others to strive for their goals.
meanings.sent5: The seemers of mystery in the old house intrigued the neighborhood kids, sparking their curiosity.
